intro: Macropodiella, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. The plants typically grow in wet, swampy areas and are often found in tropical and subtropical regions. They have a rhizomatous growth habit, which allows them to spread vegetatively. Macropodiella species are also known for their ability to thrive in waterlogged soils, making them important components of wetland ecosystems.
